plausible_answers.text: if the risk of cardiovascular events is felt to be high and early PCI is being considered

qas.question: What is NSTEACS an abbreviation for?
Clopidogrel is a form of what inhibitor?

plausible_answers.text: inhibitors of the platelet glycoprotein αIIbβ3a receptor

qas.question: What inhibitors are used in low-risk scenarios?
Eptifibatide has what kind of molecular weight?

context: People with an acute coronary syndrome where <b1_0>no ST elevation<b1_0/> is demonstrated (non-ST elevation ACS or NSTEACS) are treated with aspirin. Clopidogrel is added in many cases, particularly <b0_0>if the risk of cardiovascular events is felt to be high and early PCI is being considered<b0_0/>. Depending on whether early PCI is planned, a factor <b2_0>Xa<b2_0/> inhibitor or a potentiator of antithrombin (fondaparinux or <b4_0>low<b4_0/> molecular weight heparin respectively) may be added. In very high-risk scenarios, <b3_0>inhibitors of the platelet glycoprotein αIIbβ3a receptor<b3_0/> such as eptifibatide or tirofiban may be used.
